column1: @entity2's Birthday @entity2 was feeling happy as he looked into his bedroom mirror. He knew that tomorrow would be his birthday. @entity2 would be seven years old and his daddy was going to take him somewhere special. @entity2's little brother @entity0 was playing with his alphabet blocks on the floor. @entity2 walked over and pat him on the shoulder. "@entity1 said he's taking me to the new yogurt store," he told @entity0. @entity0 is four years old so he asked @entity2 what a yogurt store was. "Yogurt is like ice cream," he told @entity0, "and I'm going to get cherry." @entity0 said that he wanted cherry, too.  Then @entity2 walked over to the closet. He looked at his favorite shirt and pants to wear tomorrow. Then he looked at his shiny black pair of shoes. He smiled because he would have a nice shirt, pair of pants, and pair of shoes to wear for his birthday. The two boys then heard the front door open and close. They raced down the stairs to greet their father. "@entity1, I'm ready for my birthday," @entity2 said. "Me too," said @entity0. Their father laughed as he picked them up and carried them upstairs.
@placeholder did the boys say to their father
@entity2 said that he was ready for his birthday, and so did @entity0.
@entity2 and @entity0 told him that they wanted cherry yogurt.
@entity2 said that he was ready for his birthday, and so did @entity0.
@entity2 and @entity0 said that they wanted pizza instead of yogurt.
@entity2 and @entity0 said that they would be four years old.
